title: HTTP Method Selection and Execution
description: Verify that the user can select each supported HTTP method (GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS) and the HTTP request node executes successfully with the selected method.

steps.description: Drag and drop HTTP Request node onto pipeline canvas
Open node configuration panel
Select HTTP method from dropdown (test all supported methods one by one)
Enter valid URL without template variables
Execute the node
Verify the request is sent using the selected HTTP method
Verify the output panel displays correct HTTP status code and response details

title: URL Configuration with Absolute and Relative URLs and Template Variables
description: Verify that the HTTP Request node accepts valid absolute URLs, relative URLs, and URLs containing template variables, with real-time validation feedback.

steps.description: Configure node with absolute URL without template variables
Verify URL validation succeeds
Configure node with relative URL path
Verify URL validation succeeds
Configure node URL using valid template variables (e.g., {{input.userId}})
Verify real-time validation accepts template syntax
Input invalid URL or malformed template variable
Verify URL validation failure and appropriate error feedback

title: Authentication Schemes Verification
description: Verify the node supports all authentication schemes (none, Basic Auth, Bearer Token, Custom Headers, API Key) and that credentials/tokens are applied correctly.

steps.description: Select 'None' authentication
Execute request and verify no authentication header is sent
Select Basic Auth and input username and password
Execute request
Verify Authorization header contains Base64 encoded credentials
Select Bearer Token authentication and input token
Execute request
Verify Authorization header is set to Bearer token
Select Custom Header and input custom header key and value
Execute request
Verify custom header is included in the request headers
Select API Key authentication with all supported injection methods (header, query parameter)
Execute request
Verify API Key is transmitted correctly based on selected method

title: Headers and Query Parameters Management
description: Verify that headers and query parameters can be toggled on/off, edited using JSON editors, support template variables, and the final request contains correct headers and parameters.

steps.description: Enable headers toggle and add multiple headers (including template variables)
Verify JSON editor supports valid JSON including template syntax
Enable query parameters toggle and add multiple parameters (including template variables)
Verify JSON editor supports valid JSON including template syntax
Execute request
Verify all headers and query parameters are included accurately in the HTTP request
Input invalid JSON in headers or query parameters JSON editor
Verify validation errors are shown and request execution is blocked

title: Request Body Configuration and Content Types
description: Verify that the user can configure the request body with different content types (JSON, Form Data, Form URL Encoded, Raw text) including template expressions and that bodies are sent correctly.

steps.description: Set content type to JSON and input valid JSON body with template variables
Execute request
Verify request body is serialized as JSON with substituted template values
Set content type to Form Data and input key-value pairs including template expressions
Execute request
Verify request body is encoded as multipart/form-data correctly
Set content type to Form URL Encoded with key-value pairs
Execute request
Verify request body is URL encoded correctly
Set content type to Raw text and input plain text including template expressions
Execute request
Verify raw body content is sent correctly with template substitutions
Input invalid JSON body
Verify validation error message appears and execution is blocked

title: Advanced Options Configuration and Impact
description: Verify advanced HTTP request options such as timeout, follow redirects, SSL verification, and response format selection function correctly and affect request execution as expected.

steps.description: Set a short timeout value and execute request to a slow-responding endpoint
Verify the request times out and error handling displays timeout message
Toggle follow redirects off and execute a request to an endpoint that performs HTTP redirect
Verify redirect is not followed and response status reflects redirect (e.g., 3xx)
Toggle SSL verification off and execute request to HTTPS endpoint with self-signed certificate
Verify request succeeds without SSL errors
Set response format to different options (JSON, text, etc.)
Execute requests
Verify the output panel displays the response body correctly according to the selected format

title: Output Panel Verification for Request and Response Details
description: Verify that the output panel displays comprehensive data including execution status, HTTP status code, request headers, response headers, request body, response body, execution time, and multiple views (table, JSON, schema).

steps.description: Execute an HTTP request node
Verify output panel shows execution status (success or error)
Verify HTTP status code is displayed
Verify request headers and request body are visible
Verify response headers and body are displayed
Verify execution time is shown
Switch between table, JSON, and schema views of response body
Verify response is correctly displayed in all supported views

title: Error Handling and Retry Suggestions
description: Verify error handling logic displays full error messages, network errors, HTTP error details, and actionable retry suggestions in the output panel when requests fail.

steps.description: Execute request to an invalid URL or offline endpoint
Verify network error details are displayed with retry recommendations
Execute request that returns HTTP error codes (4xx, 5xx)
Verify error response status, headers, body and error messages are displayed in output panel
Verify retry suggestions or instructions for errors are visible and clear

title: Template Variable Syntax and Real-time Validation
description: Verify that template variables can be used in URL, headers, query parameters, and body fields with correct syntax and that real-time validation alerts invalid template expressions.

steps.description: Enter valid template variables (e.g., {{input.userId}}) in all supported fields
Verify real-time validation accepts variables and no errors shown
Enter invalid template expressions (e.g., unclosed braces, wrong format)
Verify validation errors are shown immediately
Execute requests with template variables resolving to valid values
Verify template variables are correctly substituted in final request

title: Integration with Pipeline Execution Engine and Logging
description: Verify that requests and responses are fully captured and logged by the pipeline execution engine, supporting data chaining and debugging within the pipeline.

steps.description: Execute HTTP Request node within a simple pipeline
Verify execution engine logs include request method, URL, headers, body, response status, headers, body, and execution timings
Chain output data to a subsequent node via configuration
Verify downstream node receives expected data from HTTP response

title: Request Timeout and Cancellation Handling
description: Verify that the request timeout option works correctly, aborting requests exceeding timeout, and that cancellation produces correct error handling and output feedback.

steps.description: Set request timeout to a low value
Execute request to an endpoint with delayed response
Verify request is aborted after timeout and timeout error is shown
Manually cancel an ongoing request execution
Verify cancellation is handled gracefully with appropriate user feedback and no unhandled errors

title: Exporting and Copying Response Data
description: Verify that the user can copy, download, and export the HTTP response data from the output panel in supported formats.

steps.description: Execute an HTTP request node successfully
Use copy button to copy response data
Verify response data is copied to clipboard in expected format
Use download button to save response data as file
Verify downloaded file content matches response data
Use export functionality to export response in available formats
Verify exported data is correctly formatted and includes all necessary fields

title: Validation of Malformed Input in Configuration Panels
description: Verify that invalid inputs such as malformed JSON, invalid URLs, and incorrect data formats are detected promptly with user-friendly error messages and prevent execution.

steps.description: Enter invalid JSON in headers or query parameters editor
Verify validation error message is displayed and request execution button is disabled
Enter malformed URL (missing scheme, invalid characters)
Verify validation error message shown next to URL field
Enter invalid data type in request body as per selected content type
Verify validation error displayed and execution prevented
